etymology.description: 丵(丵) ("tool for digging") + 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") + 又(又) (yòu, "hand") -> originally related to developing land -> borrowed for "to reply" -> 又 evolved to 寸(寸) (cùn) in seal script
etymology.interpretation: The character 對(對) (duì, "corrects; right") originally depicted a hand and tool working the earth, possibly related to cultivation. It was later borrowed for meanings related to replying or responding, with script evolution creatively altering its components.
etymology.simplification: The simplified form 对(對) removes components for a streamlined appearance.

examples.chinese: 他的判断对(他的判斷對)，解决问题更高效(解決問題更高效)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de pànduàn duì, jiějué wèntí gèng gāoxiào.
examples.english: His judgment is correct, making problem solving more efficient.

examples.chinese: 这个答案对(這個答案對)。
